20.1. [Erchambertus] Expositio in Iohannes.
Exposition | John
Manuscripts:
1. Berlin, Staatsbibliothek - Preussischer Kulturbesitz Phillipps 1731, f. 9-12. saec. ix3/3; N.E, France?. (S)
2. Cologne, Dombibliothek 16, f. 60r-90r. saec. ix-x; Germany.
3. Karlsruhe, Landesbibl. Aug. Perg. 199, p. 180-331. saec. ix-x’ S.W. Germany? Hrabanus Maurus’ name appears in the title, but it is erased  (S)
4. Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 15024, f. 1-96. saec. xviii. Enhueber’s MS. (S)
5. Wolfenbüttel. Weissenburg 87A. saec. ix2; Upper Rhine?
Bibliography:
1. Schönbach, pp. 127-129 attributed work to Walahfrid Strabo.
2. Gorman, Michael, “The Oldest Epitome of Augustine’s Tractatus in Euangelium Ioannis and Commentaries on the Gospel of John in the Early Middle Ages,” Revue des Études Augustiniennes 43 (1997), 79-81.
3. Gorman, Michael, “From the Classroom at Fulda under Hrabanus: The Commentary on the Gospel of John Prepared by Ercanbertus for his Praeceptor Ruodulfus,” Augustinianum 44 (2004), 471-502.
